page.title: 11ECOLOGY
page.content: Our block is mainly countryside.It is a limestone ridge running through a clay vale. Farming is intensive, but the fields are small with thick hedgerows.These contain much wildlife. There are few trees due to Dutch Elm disease,but there are some hedgerow oaks,and several sizeable deciduous woods(oak,beech,hazel,ash).Small elms are growing again. The river Stour flows slowly through .Some dirty foam at a weir suggests pollution, perhaps silage effluent or sewage.There is a good stock of fish ( pike,chubb,eel, dace,roach )but no trout or salmon.Wet lands along the flood plain provide a haven for flora and fauna.Organised syndicate shooting at the Hinton Estate (1,500 pheasants released each year )and rough shooting to the west occurs.Fishing clubs and a bailiff use the river.Footpaths cross the block.
